meanings.definition: A very rich business leader with a great deal of political influence.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchs in the city owned many companies and had a say in government decisions.
meanings.sent2: The oligarchs of the tech industry were known for their power and wealth.
meanings.sent3: The oligarchs decided to have a friendly competition to see who could donate the most to charity.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, the oligarchs were like kings ruling over their empires.
meanings.sent5: The image of the oligarchs in their luxurious mansions was etched in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: A small group of people having control of a country, organization, or institution.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchs of the school's student council made all the important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The oligarchs of the music industry dictated which songs became popular.
meanings.sent3: The oligarchs of the playground decided to ban dodgeball for being too rough.
meanings.sent4: In the boardroom, the oligarchs strategized their next move to dominate the market.
meanings.sent5: The oligarchs of the ancient kingdom were feared and respected by all.
